## Bevy version and features

0.17, features were
```
    "std",
    "x11",
    "bevy_winit",
    "bevy_state",
    "bevy_window",
    "bevy_pbr",
    "bevy_sprite",
    "bevy_text",

    "bevy_picking",
    "animation",
    "png",
    "zstd_rust",
    "tonemapping_luts",
    "ktx2",
```

## Relevant system information

Arch linux with sway/wayland.

## What you did

I run an example in `bevy_inspector_egui` and quit the window, and got this panic:
Describe how you arrived at the problem. If you can, consider providing a code snippet or link.

```
thread 'main' (249133) panicked at /home/jakob/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/bevy_ecs-0.17.1/src/error/handler.rs:125:1:
Encountered an error in command `<bevy_ecs::system::commands::entity_command::insert<bevy_window::cursor::CursorIcon>::{{closure}} as bevy_ecs::error::command_handling::CommandWithEntity<core::result::Result<(), bevy_ecs::world::error::EntityMutableFetchError>>>::with_entity::{{closure}}`: The entity with ID 0v0 does not exist (enable `track_location` feature for more details)

    If you were attempting to apply a command to this entity,
    and want to handle this error gracefully, consider using `EntityCommands::queue_handled` or `queue_silenced`.

note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```

I can't reproduce this sadly, so it might be a race condition / missing system ordering.

issue.body:
# Objective

Fixes #21293
Fixes #17314 to ensure that this is tested correctly.

## Solution
when despawning an entity, previously the swapped in (archetype) or moved in entity (table) (which both require extra bookkeeping to update archetype or table rows) were marked as `spawned_or_despawned` by the location and tick that the to-be-removed entity was meant to be marked, while the to-be-removed entity wasn't marked.
As pointed out by @akimakinai in [#19047](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/19047), I've re-added the correct `mark_spawn_despawn` call to `despawn_with_caller`.

## Testing

I've added a test `spawned_after_swap_remove` that ensures that despawning an entity by swapping doesn't effect other entities `spawned_or_despawned` location, and that it does effect the despawned entity's index's `spawned_or_despawned` location.

Co-Authored By: waterwhisperer24@qq.com
